Introduction

Sandara Park, also known simply as Dara, is a South Korean singer, actress, and television host. She is widely recognized for her tenure with the influential K-pop girl group 2NE1, which was managed by YG Entertainment. As of September 1, 2021, she is affiliated with ABYSS Entertainment.

Dara’s foray into the entertainment industry began with her participation in the Filipino talent show “Star Circle Quest” in 2004, where she emerged as the runner-up. Capitalizing on her newfound popularity, she released her debut mini-album titled “Sandara” in April of the same year, marking her solo debut.

Her career trajectory took a significant turn when she ventured into the K-pop scene with the debut of 2NE1 on May 6, 2009. The group quickly rose to prominence and became one of the most iconic names in K-pop history.

Following the expiration of her contract with YG Entertainment, Dara signed with ABYSS Company on September 1, 2021. She continued to make strides in her solo career and, on June 23, 2023, announced the upcoming release of her self-titled Korean-language extended play (EP), “Sandara Park,” later released on July 12, 2023.
